TriggerActionCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of TriggerAction objects.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class TriggerActionCollection : System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Windows.TriggerAction>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.TriggerAction>, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Windows.TriggerAction>, System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • TriggerActionCollection

Removes from the collection the item that is located at the specified index.

    Initializes an instance of the TriggerActionCollection class.

    Parameters

    • initialSize

      The size of the collection.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of items in the collection.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

      The number of items that the collection contains.

  • IsReadOnly

    Gets a value that indicates whether the collection is read-only.

    public bool IsReadOnly { get; }

    • Boolean

      true if the collection is read-only; otherwise, false.

    • TriggerAction

Methods

    Begins at the specified index and copies the collection items to the specified array.

      The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the items that are copied from the collection. The array must use zero-based indexing.

      Int32

    Returns

      The index of value if the TriggerAction object is found in the collection; otherwise, -1.

    Inserts the specified item into the collection at the specified index.

    public void Insert (int index, System.Windows.TriggerAction value);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index where the value must be inserted.

    • value
      TriggerAction

      The TriggerAction object to insert into the collection.

  • Remove(TriggerAction)

    Removes the first occurrence of the specified object from the collection.

    public bool Remove (System.Windows.TriggerAction value);

    Parameters

    • value
      TriggerAction

      The TriggerAction object to remove from the collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if item is successfully removed; otherwise, false. This method also returns false if item was not found in the TriggerActionCollection.

  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes from the collection the item that is located at the specified index.

    public void RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the item to remove.
